newsitem.title: UK: UK cable companies to attack BSkyB - report.
newsitem.headline: UK cable companies to attack BSkyB - report.

text.p: U.K. cable companies will renew their attack on British Sky Broadcasting Group (BSkyB) on Tuesday, claiming the company is acting anti-competitively in the supply of pay-television programming in the United Kingdom, the Independent newspaper said.
For the first time, leading cable operators NYNEX CableComms Group and Telewest Communications Plc are joining the anti-BSkyB campaign.

In a statement signed by U.K. cable operators, the industry will reject BSkyB's most recent rate card, which lays out the terms and prices under which BSkyB's channels are offered on a wholesale basis to the cable industry.

The companies are even threatening legal action and will call again on the Office of Fair Trading (OFT) to re-examine the company's dominant position in the market for pay-TV programming, the newspaper reported.
